meanings.definition: To burn superficially or slightly; scorch.
meanings.sent1: Be careful not to sweal your hand on the hot pan.
meanings.sent2: The sun can sweal your skin if you stay out too long.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally swealed the toast, making it extra crispy.
meanings.sent4: The candle swealed the edge of the table, leaving a mark.
meanings.sent5: The match's flame swealed the paper, creating a small black spot.

meanings.sent1: She had a painful sweal on her finger from touching the hot stove.
meanings.sent2: The doctor treated the sweal on his arm with ointment.
meanings.sent3: The chef's finger had a tiny sweal after touching the hot pot.
meanings.sent4: The sweal on her heel made it uncomfortable to walk.
meanings.sent5: The sweal on his shoulder was a reminder of the camping trip mishap.
